poem:
**Morning Headlines**

Today, the news unfurls like a map  
of uncertain borders and distant bays,  
where aspirations float, then sink.  
In the steady hum of policies,  
two scholars become shadows on a tarmac,  
marked by the weight of ink and decree,  
as dawn presses its fingerprint  
upon the thin paper of dreams.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Here’s what you need to know about your rights when entering the US Since Donald Trump returned to the White House, he has carried out the hardline immigration policies he promised on the campaign trail. Trump’s administration sent migrants to the Guantánamo Bay naval base in Cuba – with little access to legal counsel – and singled out two pro-Palestinian academics for deportation. The administration also failed to return El Salvador-destined deportation flights in potential". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
